Label: LANL 1994 Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer Key Parameters - Reiner Friedel (LANL)

DatasetLink.Title: Accessing more recent LANL SOPA and MPA data
More LANL Synchronous Orbit Energetic Particle (SOPA) data, information and plots at

VariableDescription.Name: sc_loc
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           LANL GEO Energetic Particle
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     LANL1994_084>Los Alamos National Laboratory 1994
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SPA>Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Electron, proton and helium measurements are taken every 160 ms from one
#                                     of the three telescopes according to the following sequence:  T1, T2, T3,
#                                     T2, T1, T2 etc.  Heavy ion data accumulated from each of the three telescopes
#                                     again according to the timing and sequence above and summed for 10.24 seconds
#                                     which is approximately one spacecraft rotation.  SOPA Key Parameters are
#                                     normally averaged over three telescopes for ~ 1 minute (6 - 10.24 second
#                                     data accumulation cycles) giving an average over much of the sky.  The time
#                                     associated with each set of Key Parameters is determined by using the time
#                                     (in minutes of the day) at the start of each data collection cycle as an index
#                                     into an array of 1440 time slots dividing the day into 1440 one minute
#                                     intervals.  The time reported is the midpoint of each interval.
#                                     We provide six fluxes:
#                                     Low energy Protons:  50 keV to 400 keV
#                                     High energy Protons: 1.2 MeV to 5 MeV
#                                     Low energy Electrons:  50 keV to 225 keV
#                                     High energy Electrons: 315 keV to 1.5 MeV
#                                     Helium      : ~0.9 MeV to ~1.3 Mev
#                                     Heavy Ions  : ~5 MeV to ~15 MeV (includes carbon, nitrogen,
#                                     and oxygen
#                                     We also compute two electron temperatures and densities and two proton
#                                     temperatures and densities.  These are based on approximately the same energy
#                                     ranges as the fluxes given in above and are determined for relativistic
#                                     Maxwellian distributions.
#                                     
#                                     Status of SOPA Instrument 1994-084:  Operating normally as of 01-Jan-1996
#                                     
#                                     Data is flagged with a data quality flag as follows:
#                                     +1 Data is Good
#                                     0 Data is Suspect
#                                     -1 Data is Unusable
#                                     LANL personnel should be contacted before using any data tagged as suspect.
#                                     References:   Belian, R. D., Gisler, G. R., Cayton, T. E., Christensen, R. A.,
#                                     High-Z Energetic Particles at Geosynchronous Orbit During The Great Solar
#                                     Proton Event Series of October 1989, J. Geophys. Res., 97, 16897, 1992
#     MODS                            created 30-Nov-1992
#                                     added text to describe instrument 04-Feb-1993
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0100
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 l4_k0_spa_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  l4_k0_spa
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      LANL 1994 Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer Key Parameters
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     PI_NAME                         Reiner Friedel
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  LANL
#     NSSDC_ID                        spms-00230
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              LANL1994_SPA_Key-Parameters-K0_1min_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   LANL
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#     LINK_TITLE                      Accessing more recent LANL SOPA and MPA data
#                                     More LANL Synchronous Orbit Energetic Particle (SOPA) data, information and                            
#                                      plots at                                                                                              
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/Recent_LANL_Data.html
#                                     http://www.lanl-epdata.lanl.gov
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, centered
#  2. Spacecraft position, geographic (latitude, longitude (deg), radius (RE))
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:15:59 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#
EPOCH                             S/C_LATITUDE          S/C_LONGITUDE       S/C_ORBIT_RADIUS
                             (@_S/C Latitude_)     (@_S/C Longitude_)  (@_S/C Orbit Radius_)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms                 Degrees                Degrees            Earth_radii
16-02-1996 00:00:37.000              -0.761992                103.354                6.61984

VariableDescription.Name: spa_e_temp
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Electron temperature in 2 energy bands (50-225 keV, 315-1500 keV)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           LANL GEO Energetic Particle
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     LANL1994_084>Los Alamos National Laboratory 1994
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SPA>Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Electron, proton and helium measurements are taken every 160 ms from one
#                                     of the three telescopes according to the following sequence:  T1, T2, T3,
#                                     T2, T1, T2 etc.  Heavy ion data accumulated from each of the three telescopes
#                                     again according to the timing and sequence above and summed for 10.24 seconds
#                                     which is approximately one spacecraft rotation.  SOPA Key Parameters are
#                                     normally averaged over three telescopes for ~ 1 minute (6 - 10.24 second
#                                     data accumulation cycles) giving an average over much of the sky.  The time
#                                     associated with each set of Key Parameters is determined by using the time
#                                     (in minutes of the day) at the start of each data collection cycle as an index
#                                     into an array of 1440 time slots dividing the day into 1440 one minute
#                                     intervals.  The time reported is the midpoint of each interval.
#                                     We provide six fluxes:
#                                     Low energy Protons:  50 keV to 400 keV
#                                     High energy Protons: 1.2 MeV to 5 MeV
#                                     Low energy Electrons:  50 keV to 225 keV
#                                     High energy Electrons: 315 keV to 1.5 MeV
#                                     Helium      : ~0.9 MeV to ~1.3 Mev
#                                     Heavy Ions  : ~5 MeV to ~15 MeV (includes carbon, nitrogen,
#                                     and oxygen
#                                     We also compute two electron temperatures and densities and two proton
#                                     temperatures and densities.  These are based on approximately the same energy
#                                     ranges as the fluxes given in above and are determined for relativistic
#                                     Maxwellian distributions.
#                                     
#                                     Status of SOPA Instrument 1994-084:  Operating normally as of 01-Jan-1996
#                                     
#                                     Data is flagged with a data quality flag as follows:
#                                     +1 Data is Good
#                                     0 Data is Suspect
#                                     -1 Data is Unusable
#                                     LANL personnel should be contacted before using any data tagged as suspect.
#                                     References:   Belian, R. D., Gisler, G. R., Cayton, T. E., Christensen, R. A.,
#                                     High-Z Energetic Particles at Geosynchronous Orbit During The Great Solar
#                                     Proton Event Series of October 1989, J. Geophys. Res., 97, 16897, 1992
#     MODS                            created 30-Nov-1992
#                                     added text to describe instrument 04-Feb-1993
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0100
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 l4_k0_spa_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  l4_k0_spa
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      LANL 1994 Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer Key Parameters
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     PI_NAME                         Reiner Friedel
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  LANL
#     NSSDC_ID                        spms-00230
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              LANL1994_SPA_Key-Parameters-K0_1min_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   LANL
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#     LINK_TITLE                      Accessing more recent LANL SOPA and MPA data
#                                     More LANL Synchronous Orbit Energetic Particle (SOPA) data, information and                            
#                                      plots at                                                                                              
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/Recent_LANL_Data.html
#                                     http://www.lanl-epdata.lanl.gov
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, centered
#  2. Electron temperature in 2 energy bands (50-225 keV, 315-1500 keV)
#       NOTES:  Electron temperature determined from relativistic Maxwellian distributions and averaged over 3 11deg telescopes (separated by  30deg) rotating with spacecraft
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:16:00 2015

VariableDescription.Name: spa_p_temp
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Proton temperature in 2 energy bands (50-400 keV, 1.2-5.0 MeV)

#  1. Time, centered

#       NOTES:  Proton temperature determined from relativistic Maxwellian distributions and averaged over 3 11deg telescopes (separated by  30deg) rotating with spacecraft

16-02-1996 00:00:37.000              0.00000

#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     LANL1994_084>Los Alamos National Laboratory 1994
#     DESCRIPTOR                      SPA>Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Electron, proton and helium measurements are taken every 160 ms from one
#                                     of the three telescopes according to the following sequence:  T1, T2, T3,
#                                     T2, T1, T2 etc.  Heavy ion data accumulated from each of the three telescopes
#                                     again according to the timing and sequence above and summed for 10.24 seconds
#                                     which is approximately one spacecraft rotation.  SOPA Key Parameters are
#                                     normally averaged over three telescopes for ~ 1 minute (6 - 10.24 second
#                                     data accumulation cycles) giving an average over much of the sky.  The time
#                                     associated with each set of Key Parameters is determined by using the time
#                                     (in minutes of the day) at the start of each data collection cycle as an index
#                                     into an array of 1440 time slots dividing the day into 1440 one minute
#                                     intervals.  The time reported is the midpoint of each interval.
#                                     We provide six fluxes:
#                                     Low energy Protons:  50 keV to 400 keV
#                                     High energy Protons: 1.2 MeV to 5 MeV
#                                     Low energy Electrons:  50 keV to 225 keV
#                                     High energy Electrons: 315 keV to 1.5 MeV
#                                     Helium      : ~0.9 MeV to ~1.3 Mev
#                                     Heavy Ions  : ~5 MeV to ~15 MeV (includes carbon, nitrogen,
#                                     and oxygen
#                                     We also compute two electron temperatures and densities and two proton
#                                     temperatures and densities.  These are based on approximately the same energy
#                                     ranges as the fluxes given in above and are determined for relativistic
#                                     Maxwellian distributions.
#                                     
#                                     Status of SOPA Instrument 1994-084:  Operating normally as of 01-Jan-1996
#                                     
#                                     Data is flagged with a data quality flag as follows:
#                                     +1 Data is Good
#                                     0 Data is Suspect
#                                     -1 Data is Unusable
#                                     LANL personnel should be contacted before using any data tagged as suspect.
#                                     References:   Belian, R. D., Gisler, G. R., Cayton, T. E., Christensen, R. A.,
#                                     High-Z Energetic Particles at Geosynchronous Orbit During The Great Solar
#                                     Proton Event Series of October 1989, J. Geophys. Res., 97, 16897, 1992
#     MODS                            created 30-Nov-1992
#                                     added text to describe instrument 04-Feb-1993
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0100
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 l4_k0_spa_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  l4_k0_spa
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      LANL 1994 Synchronous Orbit Particle Analyzer Key Parameters
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#     PI_NAME                         Reiner Friedel
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  LANL
#     NSSDC_ID                        spms-00230
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              LANL1994_SPA_Key-Parameters-K0_1min_cdf
#     MISSION_GROUP                   LANL
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#     LINK_TITLE                      Accessing more recent LANL SOPA and MPA data
#                                     More LANL Synchronous Orbit Energetic Particle (SOPA) data, information and                            
#                                      plots at                                                                                              
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/Recent_LANL_Data.html
#                                     http://www.lanl-epdata.lanl.gov
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, centered
#  2. Heavy Ion flux at ~5 MeV to ~15 MeV (includes carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen
#       NOTES:  Heavy Ion flux averaged over 3 11deg telescopes (separated by  30deg) rotating with spacecraft
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:16:02 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  Heavy Ion flux averaged over 3 11deg telescopes (separated by  30deg) rotating with spacecraft
#
EPOCH                             HEAVY_FLUX
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  P/(keV-cm2-ster-sec)
16-02-1996 00:00:37.000              0.00000

VariableDescription.Name: spa_e_flx
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Electron flux in 2 energy bands (50-225 keV, 315-1500 keV)
